meanings.definition: The quality or state of not deserving honor or respect.
meanings.sent1: Her unworthiness was evident when she refused to help the elderly lady.
meanings.sent2: The feeling of unworthiness overwhelmed him as he entered the prestigious event.
meanings.sent3: His unworthiness to be called a hero was quite comical among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The unworthiness of his actions weighed heavily on his conscience.
meanings.sent5: The unworthiness of the candidate was clear to everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: The condition of lacking value or merit.
meanings.sent1: The unworthiness of the old car was evident from its rusty exterior.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of unworthiness when her artwork was not appreciated.
meanings.sent3: The unworthiness of the broken toy made it the perfect candidate for the trash.
meanings.sent4: The unworthiness of the proposal was quickly recognized by the committee.
meanings.sent5: The unworthiness of the product was reflected in its low sales numbers.
